headline.main: AXIS FORCE IS HELD IN AFRICAN POCKET; Tanks and Infantry Under Heavy Allied Fire -- Two Enemy Vessels Sunk

lead_paragraph: CAIRO, Egypt, Nov. 2 -- The latest development in the British Eighth Army's westward drive, near encirclement of a sizable number of German troops, has occurred in the northern sector around the coastal road and railway, it was revealed here today.
abstract: Gers reptd held in African pocket by Brit 8th Army; much materiel menaced; RAF torpedo planes sink 2 supply ships, Tobruk area; Sgt A E McNall describes action; US bombers raid Maleme airdrome; US aerial activity described; Malta's Oct Axis plane toll; Gers admit Montgomery forces supported by tanks succeed in breaking through Axis Egyptian front positions

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: MEDITERRANEAN, AFRICAN, BALKAN AND NEAR EAST FRONT

snippet: CAIRO, Egypt, Nov. 2 -- The latest development in the British Eighth Army's westward drive, near encirclement of a sizable number of German troops, has occurred in the northern sector around the coastal road and railway, it was revealed here today...

byline.original: Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES
